function.name: DataMapAddArray
function.syntax: int DataMapAddArray(struct DataMap *ptr, char *name,int type,int dim, int32 *rng,void *data);

description.p: The DataMapAddArray function adds an array variable to a DataMap data structure.
The data structure is pointed to by the argument ptr. The name of the array variable to add is given by the zero terminated string pointed to by the argument name.
The scalar type is given by the argument type. Possible values are:

tr.td: A single character of type char.
A 16-bit short integer of type int16.
A 32-bit integer integer of type int32.
A single precision floating point number of type float.
A double precision floating point number of type double.
A pointer to a zero terminated text string of type char *.

description.p: The number of dimensions of the array are given by the argument dim and the ranges of those dimensions are stored in the array pointed to by the argument rng.
The argument data is a pointer to the location that stores the array.

function.returns: Returns zero on success. On error, (-1) is returned.

function.name: DataMapAddScalar

description.p: The DataMapAddScalar function adds a scalar variable to a DataMap data structure.
The data structure is pointed to by the argument ptr. The name of the scalar variable to add is given by the zero terminated string pointed to by the argument name.
The scalar type is given by the argument type. Possible values are:

tr.td: A single character of type char.
A 16-bit short integer of type int16.
A 32-bit integer integer of type int32.
A single precision floating point number of type float.
A double precision floating point number of type double.
A pointer to a zero terminated text string of type char *.

description.p: The argument data is a pointer to the location that stores the scalar value.

function.returns: Returns zero on success. On error, (-1) is returned.

function.name: DataMapDecodeBuffer

description.p: The DataMapDecodeBuffer function decodes a DataMap data structure from a memory buffer.
The memory buffer to decode is pointed to by the argument buf, and the size of the buffer is given by the argument size.

function.returns: Returns a pointer to the decoded data structure on success. On error, a NULL pointer is returned.
function.errors: On error, a NULL pointer is returned.

function.name: DataMapEncodeBuffer

description.p: The DataMapEncodeBuffer function encodes a DataMap data structure into a memory buffer.
The data structure is pointed to by the argument ptr.
The structure is encoded and stored in a memory buffer, the size of this memory buffer is stored at the location pointed to by the argument size.

function.returns: Returns a pointer to the memory buffer on success. On error, a NULL pointer is returned.
function.errors: On error, a NULL pointer is returned.

function.name: DataMapFread

description.p: The DataMapFread function reads a DataMap data structure from an open stream.
The structure is read from the open stream pointed to by the argument fp.

function.returns: Returns a pointer to the data structure on success. On error, a NULL pointer is returned.
function.errors: On error, a NULL pointer is returned.

description.p: The DataMapFree function releases the memory used to store a DataMap data structure.
The data structure is pointed to by the argument ptr.

function.name: DataMapFwrite

description.p: The DataMapFwrite function writes a DataMap data structure to an open stream.
The structure is written to the open file with the descriptor give by the argument fp.
The structure is pointed to by the argument ptr.

function.returns: Returns the number of bytes written to the file. On error, (-1) is returned.

function.name: DataMapMake

description.p: The DataMapMake function allocates and initializes a DataMap data structure.

function.returns: Returns a pointer to the data structure on success. On error, a NULL pointer is returned.
function.errors: On error, a NULL pointer is returned.

function.name: DataMapRead

description.p: The DataMapRead function reads a DataMap data structure from an open file.
The structure is read from the open file with the descriptor given by the argument fid.

function.returns: Returns a pointer to the data structure on success. On error, a NULL pointer is returned.
function.errors: On error, a NULL pointer is returned.

function.name: DataMapSize

description.p: The DataMapSize function calculates the number of bytes required to store a DataMap data structure.
The structure is pointed to by the argument ptr.

function.returns: Returns the size in bytes of bytes required to encode the data structure. On error, (-1) is returned.

function.name: DataMapWrite

description.p: The DataMapWrite function writes a DataMap data structure to an open file.
The structure is written to the open file with the descriptor given by the argument fid.
The structure is pointed to by the argument ptr.

function.returns: Returns the number of bytes written to the file. On error, (-1) is returned.
